intro: Tovomita stylosa, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Tovomita stylosa is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
